column4: hi guys, I have an instructional book that has an audio cd accompanying it; I tried to make a backup using brasero and it spit out a .toc + bin(i think) file . Just to confirm, i tried burning the resulting .toc unto an empty cd, using brasero, but upon reinsertion it isnt being recognized. What should I do?
I use k3b or dd for imaging cd's
alright I think I found a tutorial on how to burn using dd
by dd you can just dd if=dev/sr0 of=any.iso
why sr0 and not say cdrom0 ?
'cause dd does a block/sectorwise copy on a device
hey I tried the dd thing but its giving me an error
dd: opening `dev/sr0': No such file or directory
check mount for the correct devicename
what type of filesystem should it be? I dont think IM seeing anything resembling an Audio cd ... unless instructional audio cd have some special filtype ... http://pastebin.com/ZDZChApx
seems like cd isn't mounted right know, click under places and repeat mount-command
alright remounted, and just to be sure, played one of the audio files in the cd. http://pastebin.com/xkDViXAg
the files have little "x"'s on their icons...might this be the issue?
